content.description:
<math alttext="The figure presents a 3 row table with 3 columns of data. The heading for row 1 is “x.” The heading for row 2 is “f of x.” The heading for row 3 is “f prime of x.” The data in the table are as follows. Column 1. x is 2. f of x is 1. f prime of x is 4. Column 2. x is 3. f of x is 2. f prime of x is 5. Column 3. x is 4. f of x is 6. f prime of x is 3." overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mtable columnlines="solid" equalcolumns="true" equalrows="true" frame="solid" rowlines="solid" width="auto"> <mtr> <mtd> <mi>x</mi> </mtd> <mtd> <mn>2</mn> </mtd> <mtd> <mn>3</mn> </mtd> <mtd> <mn>4</mn> </mtd> </mtr> <mtr> <mtd> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> <mtext>  </mtext> </mrow> </mtd> <mtd> <mn>1</mn> </mtd> <mtd> <mn>2</mn> </mtd> <mtd> <mn>6</mn> </mtd> </mtr> <mtr> <mtd> <msup> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mo>′</mo> </mrow> </msup> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> <mtext>  </mtext> </mrow> </mtd> <mtd> <mn>4</mn> </mtd> <mtd> <mn>5</mn> </mtd> <mtd> <mn>3</mn> </mtd> </mtr> </mtable> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>

The table above gives values of the differentiable function <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and its derivative at selected values of <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.
content.question: If <math alttext="g" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is the inverse function of <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>, which of the following is an equation of the line tangent to the graph of <math alttext="g" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> at the point where <math alttext="x equals 2" overflow="scroll"> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="y equals, negative one fifth, times, open parenthesis, x minus 2, close parenthesis, plus 3" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mrow></math>

<math alttext="y equals, negative one fourth times, open parenthesis, x minus 2, close parenthesis, plus 1" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mrow></math>

<math alttext="y equals, one fifth times, open parenthesis, x minus 2, close parenthesis, plus 3" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mrow></math>

<math alttext="y equals, 4 times, open parenthesis, x minus 2, close parenthesis, plus 1" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mn>4</mn><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="y equals, one fifth times, open parenthesis, x minus 2, close parenthesis, plus 3" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mrow></math>

topic.text: 6.7: The Fundamental Theorem of Calculus and Definite Integrals

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
